Description of incident: Patient information was stolen from the Hillandale facility and used to file fraudulent tax returns with the Internal Revenue Service.  Patients who visited DeKalb's Hillandale facility between July and October 2010 may have had their information exposed.  It appears that affected individuals between the ages of 17 and 20 were the group affected by the filing of fraudulent tax returns.  The United States Secret Service alerted DeKalb and it is believed that the breach was just one of many similar breaches in Georgia and Alabama.  DeKalb did not reveal how the information was taken.
